title: Juventus and Atletico Madrid 'keeping tabs' on West Brom starlet Nathan Ferguson
text:
West Brom starlet Nathan Ferguson 'is on the radar of Atletico Madrid, Juventus and Marseille' as he enters the final year of his Baggies contract.

The 19-year-old England youth international, who can play either at left back or right back, is enjoying an impressive season with the Championship table-toppers.

And with his existing contract at The Hawthorns due to expire next summer, Ferguson is attracting plenty of interest from clubs at home and abroad.

A number of leading European clubs are 'keeping tabs' on West Brom's Nathan Ferguson

According to The Athletic, those three European clubs are leading the chase for the teenager at present.

Talks over a new contract are continuing but are 'not advanced'. Ferguson is reportedly happy at West Brom and won't agitate for a move away.

But he would have to move at the end of the season if an agreement can't be reached and West Brom would receive only compensation.

British clubs would have to agree a compensation fee with Albion or allow a tribunal to rule on the amount, while non-British clubs would have to pay about £420,000 in compensation.

Ferguson, 19, has impressed this season with the Baggies leading the Championship

Ferguson is 'open' to playing abroad knowing that he would likely be a squad player at one of the leading Premier League clubs.

Local lad Ferguson joined the West Brom academy at the age of eight and has broken into the first team this season under new manager Slaven Bilic.

It came after consistently strong performances in the Baggies Under-23 side in the Premier League 2 in the past couple of years, where he was deployed mainly as a centre back.

He has played in 11 of his side's 13 matches so far this season with the Baggies staying top of the table following a 1-0 win at Middlesbrough on Saturday.
